metadata.title: CVE-2021-45486 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the IPv4 implementation in the Linux kernel before 5.12.4,net/ipv4/route.c has an information leak because the hash table is verysmall.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45486` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-lowlatency - 4.4.0-223.256
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-lowlatency - 4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1104-kvm - 4.4.0-1104.113
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1139-aws - 4.4.0-1139.153
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1111-aws - 4.15.0-1111.118~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1123-azure - 4.15.0-1123.136~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1108-gcp - 4.15.0-1108.122~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1080-oracle - 4.15.0-1080.88~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-223.256').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1104.113').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.153').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1111.118~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1123.136~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1108.122~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.88~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
